page.title: 19Little Wellhouse Farm.
page.content: This farm has been the home of the same family since the Great War of 1914.The main house is over 300 years old and it used to be the place where the pig food was kept.The house like most of the other buildings is of timbered structure and has been well preserved.The most worrying moment within the house was probably when a little owl got stuck down the chimney. The farm can be reached by turning off Blackshots Lane opposite William Edwards playing fields.There is a pond on the approach to the farm where willow trees have been planted. Here,sparrows,starlings,blackbirds, thrushes and moorhens can be seen.The pond itself is hundreds of years old and contains frogs and newts.In the past this pond was used to drain the farmland,but this is not the case today.
